Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2010 05:44PM rosieS wrote: Hi Sue, I just had a stereotactic biopsy for calcifications last Wednesday and thank God, my breast changes were all benign processes (I am a 6 year survivor of Stage 3 breast cancer and this was the contralateral breast).   I had mine done at the radiologist's office and I asked my primary care physician to prescribe some Xanax for me to take before the procedure.  I practiced with the Xanax at home the week before to figure out the right amount and the right timing for me, since I had never taken any antianxiety meds before.  But I highly recommend them for this procedure!   My machine did not make the noises others are describing, only an initial "pop" when the skin is pierced with the tool.  You do need to lay quite still, but you can converse if you want to.  My face and ear hurt the most from jamming them into the hard table.  I actually needed to put my entire arm and shoulder into the opening, since the calcifications were close to the chest wall.  They had some kind of strap under the table to hold my arm so it wasn't dangling.   All in all, the pre-anxiety was worse than the actual experience.  Good luck! You can do it!  Hoping for benign! Rosie
